content: loretto road cowl by joanna herriott loretto road cowl the loretto road cowl named after the road where my grandparents lived is a small neck warmer which can to be worn inside the neck of a coat or just to add a little touch of colour and knitting to an outfit designed to use just one ball of yarn this cowl is the perfect small knit…whether that s for gifting or for yourself information yarn requirements 25g 140m brushed alpaca silk yarn or 50g 160-200m fingering weight yarn sample 1 was knit using drops brushed alpaca silk 77% alpaca 23% silk 140m in 25g in light grey sample 2 was knit using drops baby alpaca silk 70% alpaca and 30% silk in light grey needles us 4/3 50 mm 22-24 circular needle notions 4 stitch markers spare needle for 3-needle bind off tapestry needle gauge 24 sts x 40 row for 4 /10 cm over pattern blocked while gauge is not so important for this pattern getting a different gauge could mean that you use more yarn or don t get the same drape in your finished
